citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
The facility failed to contact their attending veterinarian regarding a dog with a positive heartworm test. An adult female
poodle “Coco” (Microchip 99100300036) was positive for heartworm antigen during her annual heartworm test which was
reported on 18 February 2025. The facility recognized the positive result but did not communicate with the AV regarding
treatment recommendations. When asked how the animal was treated the representative responded that injectable
ivermectin was given orally once in addition to the monthly prevention dose per the program of veterinary care. When
reviewing the program of veterinary care for heartworm disease it states to contact your veterinarian for various treatment
options but does not describe a method to treat heartworm disease. The dose of ivermectin was administered on 3 March
2025 per available medical records. When speaking with the AV he explained to the facility representative that ivermectin
alone does not treat or resolve an adult heartworm infection and a different medication would need to be administered by
the AV.
Failure to contact the attending veterinarian in a timely manner when illness or medical conditions such as heartworm
disease are identified by the facility or testing results can lead to a delay in treatment for the animal with potential
worsening of the condition, unnecessary suffering, or even death. Correct by ensuring there is direct and frequent
communication with the attending veterinarian so that timely and accurate information on problems of animal health,
behavior, and well-being can be addressed and treatment
or additional testing be implemented as needed.
Corrected at the time of inspection.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
